question: Find $\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 5 \\ -2 & 4 \end{pmatrix} + \begin{pmatrix} 0 & -3 \\ 8 & -5 \end{pmatrix}.$
agents_response:
To add two matrices, we simply add the corresponding entries. This gives 
$\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 5 \\ -2 & 4 \end{pmatrix} + \begin{pmatrix} 0 & -3 \\ 8 & -5 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 1+0 & 5+(-3) \\ -2+8 & 4+(-5) \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 6 & -1 \end{pmatrix}$.

So, the answer is $\boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 6 & -1 \end{pmatrix}}.$
